cards.title: Athletics / Jessica Ennis-Hill to gauge world championship form at Anniversary Games
cards.rawTitle: Jessica Ennis-Hill to gauge world championship form at Anniversary Games

item.title: Jessica Ennis-Hill to gauge world championship form at Anniversary Games
item.trailText: Jessica Ennis-Hill will compete in three events at the Anniversary Games in what is set to prove the acid test of her readiness for next month‚Äôs world championships in Beijing
item.standFirst:
‚Ä¢ Ennis-Hill to contest 100m hurdles, long jump and 200m at Olympic Stadium
‚Ä¢ Olympic heptathlon champion to make decision over world championships
item.body:
Jessica Ennis-Hill will compete in three events at the Anniversary Games in what is set to prove the acid test of her readiness for next month‚Äôs world championships in Beijing.

The Olympic heptathlon champion will return to the stadium where she won London 2012 gold, racing in the 100m hurdles on Friday 24 July and then contesting the long jump and 200m the following day.

Related: Jessica Ennis-Hill third in 100m hurdles but will delay decision on Beijing

It will be the 29-year-old‚Äôs first Diamond League event for two years following her return after the birth of her son Reggie, and how she fares will be a decisive factor in whether she opts to go to the world championships.

She said: ‚ÄúTo be back competing at this level is a daunting test as it‚Äôs only my fourth competition of the year. The events will be tough with great international and domestic fields, but I need to find out if I will be ready for Beijing and then ultimately Rio [2016].

‚ÄúI am really looking forward to competing in the Olympic Stadium again and I hope the British fans will turn out to support me and the other athletes on what I‚Äôm sure will be another incredible night of athletics.‚Äù

Ennis-Hill revealed earlier this month she would make a last-minute decision on whether to go to Beijing. The Great Britain team will be selected on 27 July, the Monday after the Anniversary Games.

The achilles issues Ennis-Hill suffered after returning appear to have cleared up, but she has said her speed needs to improve if she is to contend for a medal in China.

Ennis-Hill will compete alongside Mo Farah and Usain Bolt on the opening night of the Anniversary Games.

cards.title: Rugby league / Papua New Guinea police call for ban on State of Origin broadcasts due to killings
cards.rawTitle: Papua New Guinea police call for ban on State of Origin broadcasts due to killings

item.title: Papua New Guinea police call for ban on State of Origin broadcasts due to killings
item.trailText: Police want live feeds banned after a youth was charged with killing another over a match result, while a fight after round two led to a death in Port Moresby
item.standFirst: Police want live feeds banned after a youth was charged with killing another over a match result, while a fight after round two led to a death in Port Moresby
item.body:
Related: Woman accused of sorcery reportedly hacked to death in Papua New Guinea

Live State of Origin broadcasts should be banned in Papua New Guinea because post-match violence is resulting in ‚Äúa lot of killings‚Äù, local police say.

Enga provincial police commander, George Kakas, wants the live feeds banned amid local reports a youth was charged with killing another over a match result, while a fight after Game II led to the death of a man in Port Moresby.

‚ÄúI call on the government of Papua New Guinea to ban the live coverage of Origin matches in Papua New Guinea,‚Äù a police spokesman told the ABC.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a game where people normally watch and enjoy themselves but nowadays its not that, its changing, supporters of the Blues and supporters of the Maroons, they‚Äôve started to hate each other, argue,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThere are a lot of killings around the place because of State of Origin matches.‚Äù

The game is taken very seriously in the Pacific Island nation ‚Äì the only country in the world where rugby league is the national sport.

headerImage.caption: Queensland captain Cameron Smith (centre) with possession during State of Origin Game III against NSW. PNG police want live broadcasts 0f Origin banned due to the alleged resulting violence.  Photograph: Dave Hunt/AAP
headerImage.cleanCaption: Queensland captain Cameron Smith (centre) with possession during State of Origin Game III against NSW. PNG police want live broadcasts 0f Origin banned due to the alleged resulting violence.

snap.title: Papua New Guinea police call for ban on State of Origin broadcasts due to killings

cards.title: Snooker / Ronnie O‚ÄôSullivan claims he was offered money to throw a snooker match
cards.rawTitle: Ronnie O‚ÄôSullivan claims he was offered money to throw a snooker match

item.title: Ronnie O‚ÄôSullivan claims he was offered money to throw a snooker match
item.trailText: Ronnie O‚ÄôSullivan has claimed he was offered money to throw a snooker match but turned it down as the risk was not worth taking
item.standFirst:
‚Ä¢ Five-times world champion says the risk is not worth taking
‚Ä¢ Stephen Lee‚Äôs 12-year ban has scared a lot of players, he adds
item.body:
Ronnie O‚ÄôSullivan, the five-times world snooker champion, has said he was offered money to throw a match but declined.

Speaking on The Clare Balding Show, which will air on BT Sport and BBC Two this week, O‚ÄôSullivan claimed other players did accept bribes in the past but said he believed the problem had been eradicated after Stephen Lee was banned for match-fixing.

O‚ÄôSullivan said: ‚ÄúI was offered money once to throw a game but I couldn‚Äôt do it. It‚Äôs your sport, you love your sport. They smell it anyway. The risk is just not worth taking and I couldn‚Äôt live with myself if I got involved in that.‚Äù

In 2012 Lee was suspended on match-fixing charges and the former world No5 was subsequently handed a 12-year ban.

Related: Stephen Lee banned from snooker for 12 years for seven match-fixing charges

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll go on in snooker any more because they really made an example of Stephen Lee,‚Äù O‚ÄôSullivan added. ‚ÄúThey banned him for 12 years and I think a lot of the guys that were at it, they‚Äôre thinking they wouldn‚Äôt be able to play snooker ever again.

‚ÄúSo I think it‚Äôs been stamped out of snooker now and if anyone was to do it, they know what the consequences are.‚Äù

Three weeks ago, the Irish amateur John Sutton was banned for six years after the sport‚Äôs world governing body found him guilty of match-fixing and misusing inside information.

The World Professional Billiards and Snooker Association said Sutton‚Äôs offences related to suspicious betting on his match against Scotland‚Äôs Jamie Burnett in the qualifying stages of the International Championship.

cards.title: US sports / MLB All-Star Game: American League 6-3 National League ‚Äì¬†as it happened!
cards.rawTitle: MLB All-Star Game: American League 6-3 National League ‚Äì¬†as it happened!

item.title: MLB All-Star Game: American League 6-3 National League ‚Äì¬†as it happened!
item.trailText: The American League defeated the National League 6-3 in the 86th All-Star Game in Cincinnati, securing securing AL home field advantage in the World Series
item.standFirst:
• Mike Trout becomes is the first to win back-to-back ASG MVP Awards
  • American League win home field advantage in the World Series

displayImages.altText: I know, it looks weird, but it's the All-Star Game. Mike Trout hit a home run to lead off the 2015 ASG in Cincy, then celebrated with Josh Donaldson.

bodyImages.caption: You ain‚Äôt seen me, right? National League‚Äôs Madison Bumgarner, of the San Francisco Giants, throws during the fourth inning of the MLB All-Star baseball game. Photograph: Jeff Roberson/AP
bodyImages.altText: You ain't seen me, right? National League's Madison Bumgarner, of the San Francisco Giants, throws during the fourth inning of the MLB All-Star baseball game.
bodyImages.cleanCaption: You ain‚Äôt seen me, right? National League‚Äôs Madison Bumgarner, of the San Francisco Giants, throws during the fourth inning of the MLB All-Star baseball game.

bodyImages.caption: Call it an epiphany! Who needs real pitchers when you have a pitching machine? Photograph: unknown/unknown
bodyImages.cleanCaption: Call it an epiphany! Who needs real pitchers when you have a pitching machine?

blocks.body:
David will be here shortly. In the meantime, here‚Äôs DJ Gallo on how the Pirates are World Series contenders, and how it‚Äôs unacceptable:

You have real expectations. Pressure. A fanbase that expects greatness. You could have just been a nice team that was a nice story. But you had to mess it all up by becoming the best team in baseball.

Way to go.

Related: Pittsburgh Pirates are World Series contenders and it's unacceptable

Hello and welcome to our live coverage of Major League Baseball All-Star Game LXXXVI from Cincinnati, a contest that ‚Äúcounts‚Äù, as the winner of this furious fight will be rewarded an extra home game at the World Series, which makes perfect sense.

Chances are that some punk kid will be deciding what happens tonight - 20 players are 25 or younger, which is a lot. Baseball is bidding to squeeze out chemically-aided up hangers on by their sell by date, and the roster at the Midsummer classic looks dramatically different these days.

‚ÄúWhen I came to the All-Star Game the first time in 2012, not trying to be rude, but there were a lot of older guys playing,‚Äù recently said Bryce Harper. Very observant is that Harper.

We‚Äôll have first pitch at a little after 8PM here on the east coast of the United States, 1AM in Blighty, and 5PM on the left coast.

So, there‚Äôs time to kill - tweet something here. I promise it‚Äôll feel good.

Last night

Baseball and their marketing has been taking stick for a while now, but we call it like we see it, and those busy playing Candy Crush had good reason to put down their devices and watch the Home Run Derby last night. The new format turned an event on par with water-boarding(ish) into something that is actually watchable, complete with one-on-one play, buzzer beaters, a reason to take big cuts, and, get this...a clock!

The clock, four minutes for each player to go deep as much as possible, was the magic number, and brought a dramatic, tidy, sense of urgency to the game. You could argue that it was the star of the show, but it wasn‚Äôt. That was Todd Frazier, who has a mighty swing, but just makes me think of bad pizza, killed it in front of his home crowd, bringing even more energy to the Great American Ballpark (cue the bad Rob Manfred high fives in the MLB suite).

So, take a bow MLB, but don‚Äôt get too happy - A-Rod is still the league poster child, which is fine by me but is probably not a viable long term solution to getting your sport back on the front pages.

Rosey

Pete Rose is on TV, FOX TV here in the US to be precise, and it‚Äôs kind of awesome. In just a few minutes, he took credit for Andrew McCutchen snapping out of his slow start, claimed that he didn‚Äôt really ruin Ray Fosse‚Äôs career (more on that below), called the Big Hurt, ex-Chisox slugger and hall-of-famer Frank Thomas, fat, and more than once, and...

It‚Äôs a big night for Pete - the all-time hit king is back on his home turf amongst his crowd, given a free-pass despite his banishment from baseball for gambling as a manager, and as we‚Äôve lately learned (officially) as a player.

It‚Äôs also the 45th anniversary of his 12th inning thumping of Fosse at old Riverfront Stadium in Cincinnati. His destruction of the Cleveland Indians catcher won the game for the NL, and is a key moment in All-Star Game history. Have a look.

So, does Pete regret barreling over Fosse? Hell no!

‚ÄúHell no, I won the game!‚Äù

MLB Franchise Four

There was more than just ASG voting - fans were voting on the best four players in their franchise history. I‚Äôm going to take a stab at the Tampa Bay Rays, let‚Äôs see how I do.

  • Victor Zambrano
  • Wade Boggs (I know, he‚Äôs really a Yankee)
  • Robert Fick
  • Damian Rolls

How did I do?

Now, they‚Äôre announcing the Reds First four and the crowd is getting quite excited...

‚ÄúBig Red Machine‚Äù catcher Johnny Bench of Baseball Bunch fame gets a cheer. Then shortstop Barry Larkin, who is a local boy done good is next.

This is getting tense, will they save the best for last?

Next is second baseman Joe Morgan, who won back-to-back NL MVP‚Äôs in 1975 and 1976 which was great - the ESPN work, not so much. Still, heck of a player.

Now for the moment - ‚Äúlast but not least‚Äù....(resume announced, no gambling mention) ‚ÄúPlease welcome Pete Rose!‚Äù

Petey is on the field, and even if you like that or not, it is quite a human moment for a guy who loves baseball and is rarely allowed to face his fans. He looks a bit awkward, as he always does.

He walks off, and that‚Äôs that. You won‚Äôt see that guy in that spot for awhile.

This just in...

NL skipper Bruce Bochy, looking to fire up his team, just played a film to his team showing former NL President Warren Giles telling them to ‚Äústick it in the ear of those rotten damn AL‚Äôers.‚Äù Except they just seemed puzzled by it all.

Remember the days...

When the starting pitchers would actually pitch three innings? No more - now teams would rather not see their hurlers take to the hill in the ASG. Roben Ventura had no interest in Chris Sale throwing for the AL tonight, so that gave me an idea for next year.

They can paint in in team colors and everything! Don‚Äôt worry Chris, next year you can rest up at home.

Lineups

NL starter Zack Greinke says his family is really excited that he‚Äôs starting the ASG, but he‚Äôs still wondering if it‚Äôs a good idea that has wife schlepped out from LA because she is giving birth in about three weeks.

Greinke is a free-agent at the end of the year and could flee the Dodgers if the price is right. They‚Äôll be takers - he‚Äôs 40-14 (even if we don‚Äôt really care about wins) over the past three seasons.

Dallas Keuchel is the AL starter for an NL team, or a former NL team (my head still spins when I look at the standings), and deservedly so - he‚Äôs tearing it up in 2015 off the back of a breakout 2014.

There‚Äôs going to be a lot of moving around tonight, a lot of players on the field. So if you‚Äôre scoring at home, and there is absolutely no way in hell that you are, be prepared for a very messy scorecard.

National Anthem

Ciara is doing it live - and it‚Äôs not bad. I‚Äôll give it a 7/10.

If you‚Äôre upset you‚Äôve missed it, don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got someone named Ciara singing the song before an Appalachian Power game in 2010. Enjoy!

The very good old boys

Here comes Johnny Bench, Sandy Koufax, Willie Mays and Hank Aaron are being introduced and honored as the greatest living four, on the field before the game. We could argue this all night, and Bench was phenomenal, but, well, I don‚Äôt know. I don‚Äôt want to be rude.

Never mind.

Clayton Kershaw applauds the lefty, Sandy Koufax. Mays gets the loudest applause, and, well, hey, he looks pretty good for his age.

He throws the first pitch to bench, and it‚Äôs a strike!

We‚Äôre going to have real exhibition it counts baseball soon - I swear. Standby.

blocks.title: First pitch!
blocks.body: It‚Äôs a strike from Greinke past Mike Trout, and it‚Äôs on!

blocks.title: HOME RUN! American League 1-0 National League, top 1st
blocks.body:
Oh no, it‚Äôs not...it is! Mike Trout clears the right field fence (barely) - and that‚Äôs a (total BS ban box) home run!

Trout‚Äôs tater puts the AL in front in the very first at-bat of the game, taking a 1-2 pitch deep, silencing this already extremely quiet crowd just a little bit more.

It‚Äôs the first lead-off homer at an ASG since Bo Jackson did it in 1989. Can you believe this is his FOURTH ASG of his crazy young career? How about that?

And how about this? Greinke just misses striking out Josh Donaldson and then walks the Jays slugger. So Greinke is flumoxed, wondering what in tarnation is going on here.

And here is Albert Pujols, who along with A-Rod and Mark Teixeira, is probably a candidate for Comeback Player of the Year award.

American League 1-0 National League, top 1st

Greinke fires a bullet low, away, but on the black (which doesn‚Äôt really exist, for the first out of the LXXXVI ASG. Pujols is gone and here is Nellie Cruz bating with a man-on here...

Hats

The players are not wearing their traditional hats. They are wearing hats with painters stripes that don‚Äôt really work because the Pirates aren‚Äôt wearing them. This is a marketing ploy, but I ‚Äòll be damned if I see anyone waling around in those nasty things....

Oh, by the way, Greinke struck out Cruz, then got Lorenzo Cain to pop out to second - D.J. LeMahieu, who I guarantee many non-fantasy baseball playing fans, have barely heard of, made the easy play.

So Greinke settles in and shuts down the AL after a few early blips. Here come the AL‚Äôers.

American League 1-0 National League, bottom 1st

Andrew McCutchen pops to first, right to Pujols, which is good because here is the Toddfather, Todd Frazier, who everybody wants to see anyhow. He is the only thing that seems to get this crowd excited, and they‚Äôre on their feet cheering for their (New Jersey born) hero.

Then they‚Äôre on their seats, as their hero, bounces harmlessly to Mr Donaldson who is over at third and making it look easy. Keuchel looks sharp - two down.

American League 1-0 National League, bottom 1st

Now it‚Äôs big bad Bryce with his body for sin (did you know he was on a strict diet for that ESPN skin mag shoot? He ai‚Äôt going to displace A-Rod as the face of baseball by eating kale and dropping his drawers).

Anyway, Harper grounds to third and forces Donaldson to his right - the Blue Jay makes a play and gets bryce by a step.

That‚Äôs 1-2-3 for the AL and we‚Äôre off to the second inning already.

American League 1-0 National League, top 2nd

Moving right along then - Greinke K‚Äôs Adam Jones and then faces Instagramer
extraordinaire, Salvador Perez, who has the worst contract in baseball (the wrong way) actually runs the count full, wastes a couple of pitches, and then is roasted on a 95 mph bullet on the ninth pitch.

That means four of the last five hitters he‚Äôs faced - not Jose Altuve though - he makes LeMahieu slide to his right before making the pick and throwing to first to get the fellow second baseman, and MLB‚Äôs shortest active player is the third out. Side retired...

American League 1-0 National League, bottom 2nd

Gerrit Cole is warming up for the NL as Paul Goldschmidt, who is a little like a secret Babe Ruth, steps in to face Keuchel.

Have you ever seen a slugger this good, get such little pub?

Here‚Äôs a little roller down the third base line - Donaldson will have to hurry and he AIRMAILS IT!

Pujoles doesn‚Äôt even try to jump because it‚Äôs so high (or because he can‚Äôt), and Goldy is at second.

No, now he‚Äôs at third because Buster Posey moves him over after grounding to short.

So - we have one down and Goldchmidt on third for Anthony Rizzo of the Cubs, has a very boring face but can hit despite the lack of animation in his cheek bones.

Will Goldschmidt score? Stay tuned baseball fans.

American League 1-0 National League, bottom 2nd

Rizzo is behind in the count to Keuchel, before the Cubs‚Äô franchise piece works the count full. Then he bounces to first - Pujols has it - looks back Goldschmidt at third and steps on first for the second out.

Two down and it‚Äôs up to Jhonny Peralta.

blocks.title: RUN! American League 1-1 National League, bottom 2nd
blocks.body:
Peralta dumps a base hit into right field, just beyond the reach of Cain - Goldschmidt trots home and we‚Äôre tied.

Then a past ball sends Peralta to second. So there‚Äôs a two-out runner in scoring position for the rook, Joc Pederson, who has made Dodgers fans (very very easily) forget about Matt Kemp in Los Angeles.

American League 1-1 National League, bottom 2nd

The kid strikes out, inning over, but not before the NL even it up.

American League 1-1 National League, top 3rd

Here‚Äôs Gerrit Cole, who has a 2.30 ERA for the Pirates. Felix Henandez is warming and set to come in for the AL next.

Cole faces Alcides Escobar, one of the 43 Kansas City Royals on the roster, faces the Bucs righty to start off the third. Cole, who looks just fine in painters stripes because he is a Pittsburgh Pirate, induces a pop-fly to center - his teammate McCutchen has it for the first out.

Now Trout is back, already with a homer in his back pocket.

FOX has him wired for sound and shows him in the dugout wondering why he didn‚Äôt swing in the first pitch of his first at-bat, but it‚Äôs really not that interesting.

Now Dallas Keuchel, who is done for the night, is speaking to FOX:

Everything I thought it was going to be and more. I was super amped....Outside the World Series it‚Äôs the best competition in baseball.

Then Joe Buck tells us he was an apparel major in college. Really, he said it.

Anyway, Trout strikes out. And now here‚Äôs Donaldson, who is issued a two-out walk.

That leaves it for Pujols, who is a very old raisin amongst this bunch.

He hits a bullet to center but Cutch is there for out number three. Moving on...

Hats II

Get this - someone likes the hats!? Phil Hall writes:

Hi Dave, gotta disagree about the hats. I think they look smart. Loving your coverage as always.

Sometimes I have to remind myself that I‚Äôm too old to be marketed to. Where‚Äôs the viagra ad when I need it?

American League 1-1 National League, bottom 3rd

Felix Hernandez, 29-year-old with 11 big league years banked, master of five unique pitches, is on for the AL.

He gets LeMahieu to line to center for the first out. Then King Felix zaps McCutchen for the K, and now it‚Äôs Frazier, who also has nothing vs Hernandez. A quick bouncer to short sends us to the fourth, speedily.

Dear All-Stars,

Wanted - ACTION. Please kindly send some over asap.

Yours sincerely,

David

American League 1-1 National League, top 4th

Madison Bumgarner, the Royals slayer, is on to pitch, and gets Cruz to fly to right before Lorenzo Cain, and get this, SINGLES! (true story)

I know Cain has been fantasizing about getting his revenge on MadBum for months - now he has it in a game that really counts.

Adam Jones of the O‚Äôs is up is ahead in the count 2-0 before taking a big cut, fouling off a 94 mph four-seamer. Thn he flies harmlessly to right field - Harper puts it away for the second out.

So that leaves it for Perez, who popped out to the left side vs Bumgarner to end the 2014 World Series - can he make like Cain and finally best his nemesis?

It‚Äôs 3-2 and Perez fouls it off.

Meanwhile, Harlold Reynolds of FOX TV is also getting desperate for action - he‚Äôs talking about the grunts players make, which is some real insight let me tell you. (McCarver anyone?...I know)

Perez is hanging in there against this beast - on the ninth pitch, Perez swings and misses but the ball gets past Posey! Perez heads to first and makes it with ease.

That‚Äôs a strikeout wild pitch and an extra out for the AL. Runners at the corners with two down for Altuve....

American League 1-1 National League, top 4th

Perez, reaches for it and slaps it up the middle, but LeMahieu is there and he flips it to Peralta who steps on second for the third out.

But we did have two base runners...and that‚Äôs something...right?

American League 1-1 National League, bottom 4th

David Price of Detroit (for now) takes to the hill for the AL and faces Bryce Harper, who is leading off. He‚Äôs toast on a changeup that sinks, and that‚Äôs nine k‚Äôs in this ASG so far.

Did I say nine? Oh, no, I meant 10. Goldschmidt chases junk low and away and now he grabs pine. Now Buter Posey is looking for 11, but sadly, he just lines out to right.

Inning over. Jesus this is bad.

Oh boy...

...as good as the Home Run Derby was last night, the actual game is proving a bit of a dud. But don‚Äôt get down, there‚Äôs still time, and don‚Äôt forget, IT COUNTS! And you can tell by the crowd intensity and the player grunting.

American League 1-1 National League, top 5th

Clayton Kershaw, who was a late add to the roster, gives up a base hit! It‚Äôs Alcides Escobr slaps one through the left side of the infield, just barely under the glove of Frazier at third.

Now Trout bounces to second - LeMahieu to Peralta for one, Peralta to Goldschmidt for...SAFE.

Damn, that Trout can run some can‚Äôt he? He blazes down the line and breaks up the would-be 4-6-3 DP. So one on and one out and Manny Machado (in for Donaldson if you‚Äôre scoring at home which you‚Äôre not) steps in for his first at-bat of the game.

American League 1-1 National League, top 5th

Kershaw hangs one and Machado hits a long drive to left - back for it is Pederson, he‚Äôs on the track - at the wall....and he...makes the catch!

Machado came within a few feet of putting the AL up, but it‚Äôs just a long (but not that long in Cincy) second out. Now it‚Äôs up to Pujols to cash in here. He‚Äôs 0-2 thus far.

American League 1-1 National League, top 5th

Pujols in the hole 1-2 - Kershaw just misses out the outside corner, and Albert is alive, and on first after drawing a two-out walk.

So this is a nit of a situation right here, and everybody‚Äôs favorite former vegetarian, Prince Fielder, steps up to the plate with two gentlemen on base. Can Prince make‚Äôm pay?

blocks.title: RUN! American League 2-1 National League, top 5th
blocks.body: OH YEAH HE CAN! Fielder goes oppo with a basehit to the left side - Trout swims home (yeah I said it) and the AL are up!

blocks.title: RUN! American League 3-1 National League, top 5th
blocks.body:
Want more?Come get some - this time it‚Äôs Cain who drills one down the right field line and Pujols will score. Cain with an RBI double and Kershaw is getting hit as Didgers fans squeal.

Second and third and here‚Äôs Brett Grdner, sometimes known as Gardy, to try and pile on.

American League 3-1 National League, top 5th

Gardner strikes out, and the inning is over but we have runs runs runs! Hallelujah!

Email:

Bill Page writes:

Price will be in Detroit in 2016! They let Sherzer slip away but Price no way Hoze‚Äô.

Well, not if the tigers keep on tankin!

Tampa Bay Ray Chris Archer is on for the AL protecting a two-run lead, and looking shaky, throwing five straight balls after getting Rizzo to fly to center for the first out. Peralta walks to first - here‚Äôs Pederson.

American League 3-1 National League, bottom 5th

Woosh - Archer fires away, right past the Dodger rook, and now there‚Äôs two outs for the DJ, who lines to right - inning over.

American League 3-1 National League, top 6th

The hearts of Mets fans everywhere flutter as their AS hurler Jacob deGrom takes the ball for the NL trying to help his team stay in with a chance at having home field advantage foe the World Series.

He reels back, hair flies, batters flail - Stephen Vogt on this occasion. The A‚Äôs backstop strikes out swinging through deGrom mastery for the first out.

Jason Kipnis? No chance. The heat rises up through the zone and the Indians second baseman is defenseless. Back-to-back strikeouts for deGrom.

Who is the next fool? It‚Äôs Jose Iglesias, already behind 0-2 in the count, and now it‚Äôs all over. He whiffs and becomes the third batter to be hammered by the Mets hurler, who strikes out the side, just as another former Met, Dwight Gooden, did all the way back in 1984.

Easy.
yes...YES! That‚Äôs what I like about high school girls...

blocks.title: HOME RUN! American League 3-2 National League, bottom 6th
blocks.body: LIFE! McCutchen sets a slider sail, and it‚Äôs in the left field stands! McCutchen, tips his cap, touches home plate, acknowledges the Cincy crowd, and the NL are within a run. And here‚Äôs Todd Frazier!

American League 3-2 National League, bottom 6th

Home town heroics? No, a grounder to third - Machado makes Mark Teixeira stretch but the Yankees‚Äô first baseman has it for the out.

Now Bryce Harper comes to the plate while Ned Yost comes to the mound. The AL skipper wants to make a move - Archer is out, and the O‚Äôs closer Zach Britton is in to face the bearded Nationals brute.

How will it end?

American League 3-2 National League, bottom 6th

It‚Äôs a battle for the Beltway in Cincinnati, which doesn‚Äôt happen often. Britton comes up trumps, throwing junk outside that Harper can‚Äôt resist - he fails to check his swing, and there‚Äôs two down for Goldschmidt, who taps to Britton, who promptly throws wide, pulling Teixeira off the bag!

That‚Äôs an E-1, and Yadier Molina, aka God, is in to make Britton pay for his fielding failure. I‚Äôll be back in a minute to report on his game-tying hit.

American League 3-2 National League, bottom 6th

OK, it didn‚Äôt tie the game, but it is a hit, so some points there for me, yes?

I‚Äôm glad we agree. God goes up the middle - Goldschmidt moves to second and Dave Eiland, the Royals‚Äô pitching coach, is out for a little chat with his man.

Troy Tulowitzki up with two on and two out...

American League 3-2 National League, bottom 6th

Tulo, a tapper - Kipnis at second flips to Iglesias at shortstop and the NL threat is just that. They get a run on the Cutch jack but it could‚Äôve been so much more. On to the seventh!

Who is the next face of baseball...

...a FOX promo asks the viewer.

I have no idea, but it‚Äôs A-Rod today, tomorrow, next year and probably the year after that.

So, tune in in 2018 to find out who is the next face of baseball.

American League 3-2 National League, top 7th

Another Rod, this one ‚ÄúK‚Äù, Francisco, of Milwaukee, is in to pitch and promptly walks Trout, who is now out. Gritty little Brock Holt of Boston is the pinch-runner and Manny Machado is at the plate.

Now, I missed it, but someone on TV is comparing Mike Trout to Bo Jackson, and whoever did that is to be congratulated - that‚Äôs because for the first time in my entire existence, I have heard a white athlete compared to a black athlete. Seriously.

blocks.title: RUN! American League 4-2 National League, top 7th
blocks.body:
Holt, that little scrappy lunchpail of an engine, takes off on a ball in the dirt and now he‚Äôs at second base.

No he‚Äôs not - he‚Äôs home - Machado hits a rocket that is at the wall in right field! Holt creates a run with his base-running and helps provide the AL a two-run cushion.

That‚Äôs an RBI double for the O‚Äôs third baseman, and here‚Äôs Teixeira, who bounces to the right side, into the shift, for the first out.

Machado moves to third. One down, here‚Äôs Fielder.

blocks.title: RUN! American League 5-2 National League, top 7th
blocks.body: AL keeps runners moving and Fielder keeps them coming home - a sac fly adds to the visitors league before K-Rod gets JD Martinez to bounce out 6-3. Side retired, but K-Rod spots the AL two more runs.

Stretch time - Take Me Out to the Ballgame

With the Screaming Mimes, of course.

American League 5-2 National League, bottom 7th

Dellin Betances, the Yankees closer, born in Washington Heights Manhattan, raised in the Lower East Side, is in to pitch for the AL, and wastes little time retiring Jason Kipnis, who bounces to Teixeira, another Yankee, for the first out.

Now here‚Äôs rookie sensation, Kris Bryant of the Cubs, who is an All-Star but was not ready to start the team with the big league club. Hmmmmmm.

He works a 3-2 count vs Betances, who misses and walks the kid.

One on, one out - and here‚Äôs another New York born palyer - Joe Panik, the second baseman of the San Francisco Giants.

American League 5-2 National League, bottom 7th

Panik is the 17th strikeout victim tonight - two down for the D-Backs AJ Pollock, who is a hidden gem out in Arizona.

Pollock bounces to third, Machado is charging to his left, nearly collides with Iglesias, has it, and fires to first in time for the third out. Side retired.

American League 5-2 National League, top 8th

Here is Mark Melancon, who was a late addition to the ASG in 2013 and drove to the Queens ballpark with his wife from Pittsburgh.

Melancon gets Gardner looking for the first out.

Meanwhile, Todd Frazier tells FOX TV that there was no air conditioning in his house last night, adding to in-game interview lore.

Then pinch-hitting Russell Martin is caught looking. Two down.

blocks.title: HOME RUN! American League 6-2 National League, top 8th
blocks.body:
Brian Dozier - a deep drive to center - Pollock is going back but there‚Äôs no more room - it‚Äôs a tack-on home run for Dozier as the Twin gives the AL a late, four-run lead in his first ASG!

Jose Iglesias bounces to third where Nolan Arenado makes a play, throwing across the diamond for the final out of the inning, but it‚Äôs a slow bleed for the NL.

American League 6-2 National League, bottom 8th

Here is the ridiculous Wade Davis of the Royals and his super tiny ERA to crush NL‚Äôers. He starts with Nolan Arenado, who is totally defenseless - he strikes out.

Justin Upton, who cold find himself heading out of San Diego soon, and he somehow scratches out a base hit to left.

Now it‚Äôs a former Padre, Adrian Gonzalez stepping in, looking to get on for a team that needs base runners.

American League 6-2 National League, bottom 8th

Upton moves to second as Gonzales swings and misses on a wildly moving pitch that gets away from Martin. A-Gone is just that, whiffing for out number two.

So it‚Äôs all up to the pinch-hitting Dodgers catcher Yasmani Grandal, who comes to the plate with a man on.

American League 6-2 National League, bottom 8th

Grandal, a grounder to the left side - Iglesias, ranging to his right, getting low to make the stab, extending and firing in time to get the chugging Grandal - that is how you play shortstop - that man is insane!

Inning over.

American League 6-2 National League, top 9th

Aroldis Chapman, who throws stuff that‚Äôs hard to see, faster than a speeding bullet, puts away Brock Holt for the first at-bat.

If you‚Äôre keeping score at home you know darn well he‚Äôs the 21st strikeout victim tonight. That‚Äôs too many strikeouts. Zzzzzzzz.

Mike Moustakas, who, surprise, was voted in by the fans in the late ballot, which, but the way, A-Rod wasn‚Äôt on, is at the plate. He‚Äôs behind 1-2 to the flame-throwing Cuban, who proceeds to put him away as the radar gun reads 103 mph.

Yup, that‚Äôs what it says.

Here‚Äôs Teixeira.

American League 6-2 National League, top 9th

Teixeira chases cheese, high and away as he becomes K#23 on a 102 mph offering from the Reds rep.

Gulp.

Last of the ninth coming up!

American League 6-2 National League, bottom 9th

Perfect Glen Perkins gets hit! Ryan Braun dumps one nto the right field corner and lands safely at third! So that‚Äôs the start the NL needs here to get something going. Here is Giants shortstop Brandon Crawford...

blocks.title: RUN! American League 6-3 National League, bottom 9th
blocks.body:
Crawford lifts one to left - Braun is tagging at third and trots home - it‚Äôs a sac-fly and it cuts the AL lead to three.

Now it‚Äôs Kris Bryant, who gives it a ride, deep to right, but it does on the track and nwo the NL are down to their last out.

blocks.title: American League 6-3 National League, Final
blocks.body:
Joe Panik is the batter, and he lines to left - Holt is there to make the stab and the ballgame is over!

The AL win the 86th All-Star Game!

blocks.title: American League 6-3 National League, Final
blocks.body:
The All-Star Game is over and that means the Reds finally start selling off their team.

The American League have the home-field advantage for the World Series, where the team with an extra game has won five out of the last six Fall Classics.

Awesome.

The MVP is Mike Trout, who becomes the first player to win back-to-back ASG honors.

And that‚Äôs all folks - thanks for joining out live, MLB coverage - we‚Äôll see you in October for more minute-by-minute coverage, but for now, thanks for reading.

Good morning, good afternoon and goodnight.

keyEvents.body:
David will be here shortly. In the meantime, here‚Äôs DJ Gallo on how the Pirates are World Series contenders, and how it‚Äôs unacceptable:

You have real expectations. Pressure. A fanbase that expects greatness. You could have just been a nice team that was a nice story. But you had to mess it all up by becoming the best team in baseball.

Way to go.

Related: Pittsburgh Pirates are World Series contenders and it's unacceptable

keyEvents.title: First pitch!
keyEvents.body: It‚Äôs a strike from Greinke past Mike Trout, and it‚Äôs on!

keyEvents.title: HOME RUN! American League 1-0 National League, top 1st
keyEvents.body:
Oh no, it‚Äôs not...it is! Mike Trout clears the right field fence (barely) - and that‚Äôs a (total BS ban box) home run!

Trout‚Äôs tater puts the AL in front in the very first at-bat of the game, taking a 1-2 pitch deep, silencing this already extremely quiet crowd just a little bit more.

It‚Äôs the first lead-off homer at an ASG since Bo Jackson did it in 1989. Can you believe this is his FOURTH ASG of his crazy young career? How about that?

And how about this? Greinke just misses striking out Josh Donaldson and then walks the Jays slugger. So Greinke is flumoxed, wondering what in tarnation is going on here.

And here is Albert Pujols, who along with A-Rod and Mark Teixeira, is probably a candidate for Comeback Player of the Year award.

keyEvents.title: RUN! American League 1-1 National League, bottom 2nd
keyEvents.body:
Peralta dumps a base hit into right field, just beyond the reach of Cain - Goldschmidt trots home and we‚Äôre tied.

Then a past ball sends Peralta to second. So there‚Äôs a two-out runner in scoring position for the rook, Joc Pederson, who has made Dodgers fans (very very easily) forget about Matt Kemp in Los Angeles.

keyEvents.title: RUN! American League 2-1 National League, top 5th
keyEvents.body: OH YEAH HE CAN! Fielder goes oppo with a basehit to the left side - Trout swims home (yeah I said it) and the AL are up!

keyEvents.title: RUN! American League 3-1 National League, top 5th
keyEvents.body:
Want more?Come get some - this time it‚Äôs Cain who drills one down the right field line and Pujols will score. Cain with an RBI double and Kershaw is getting hit as Didgers fans squeal.

Second and third and here‚Äôs Brett Grdner, sometimes known as Gardy, to try and pile on.

keyEvents.title: HOME RUN! American League 3-2 National League, bottom 6th
keyEvents.body: LIFE! McCutchen sets a slider sail, and it‚Äôs in the left field stands! McCutchen, tips his cap, touches home plate, acknowledges the Cincy crowd, and the NL are within a run. And here‚Äôs Todd Frazier!

keyEvents.title: RUN! American League 4-2 National League, top 7th
keyEvents.body:
Holt, that little scrappy lunchpail of an engine, takes off on a ball in the dirt and now he‚Äôs at second base.

No he‚Äôs not - he‚Äôs home - Machado hits a rocket that is at the wall in right field! Holt creates a run with his base-running and helps provide the AL a two-run cushion.

That‚Äôs an RBI double for the O‚Äôs third baseman, and here‚Äôs Teixeira, who bounces to the right side, into the shift, for the first out.

Machado moves to third. One down, here‚Äôs Fielder.

keyEvents.title: RUN! American League 5-2 National League, top 7th
keyEvents.body: AL keeps runners moving and Fielder keeps them coming home - a sac fly adds to the visitors league before K-Rod gets JD Martinez to bounce out 6-3. Side retired, but K-Rod spots the AL two more runs.

keyEvents.title: HOME RUN! American League 6-2 National League, top 8th
keyEvents.body:
Brian Dozier - a deep drive to center - Pollock is going back but there‚Äôs no more room - it‚Äôs a tack-on home run for Dozier as the Twin gives the AL a late, four-run lead in his first ASG!

Jose Iglesias bounces to third where Nolan Arenado makes a play, throwing across the diamond for the final out of the inning, but it‚Äôs a slow bleed for the NL.

keyEvents.title: RUN! American League 6-3 National League, bottom 9th
keyEvents.body:
Crawford lifts one to left - Braun is tagging at third and trots home - it‚Äôs a sac-fly and it cuts the AL lead to three.

Now it‚Äôs Kris Bryant, who gives it a ride, deep to right, but it does on the track and nwo the NL are down to their last out.

keyEvents.title: American League 6-3 National League, Final
keyEvents.body:
Joe Panik is the batter, and he lines to left - Holt is there to make the stab and the ballgame is over!

The AL win the 86th All-Star Game!

keyEvents.title: American League 6-3 National League, Final
keyEvents.body:
The All-Star Game is over and that means the Reds finally start selling off their team.

The American League have the home-field advantage for the World Series, where the team with an extra game has won five out of the last six Fall Classics.

Awesome.

The MVP is Mike Trout, who becomes the first player to win back-to-back ASG honors.

And that‚Äôs all folks - thanks for joining out live, MLB coverage - we‚Äôll see you in October for more minute-by-minute coverage, but for now, thanks for reading.

Good morning, good afternoon and goodnight.

headerImage.caption: I know, it looks weird, but it‚Äôs the All-Star Game. Mike Trout hit a home run to lead off the 2015 ASG in Cincy, then celebrated with Josh Donaldson. Photograph: Rob Carr/Getty Images

cards.title: Australia sport / Australia's Nick Kyrgios fit to play Davis Cup quarter-final despite injury scare
cards.rawTitle: Australia's Nick Kyrgios fit to play Davis Cup quarter-final despite injury scare

item.title: Australia's Nick Kyrgios fit to play Davis Cup quarter-final despite injury scare
item.trailText: Nick Kyrgios is expected to be fit for Davis Cup duty this weekend despite a slight injury scare at training on Wednesday
item.standFirst:
• Kyrgios leaves Australia training early with tight thigh
  • Coach Wally Masur says he should be fit to face Kazakhstan on Friday
item.body:
Nick Kyrgios is expected to be fit for Davis Cup duty this weekend despite a slight injury scare at training on Wednesday. Kyrgios cut short his session after feeling tightness in his right thigh but captain Wally Masur says the 20-year-old will be ready to take on Kazakhstan in this week‚Äôs quarter-final tie in Darwin starting on Friday.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs fine,‚Äù Masur said. ‚ÄúHe played over three hours of tennis yesterday. He played a bit of basketball this morning. He‚Äôs got an opportunity to get on that match court tomorrow. No dramas there.‚Äù

The injury scare comes 24 hours after Masur scoffed at suggestions Kyrgios has become a liability, saying Australia‚Äôs second ranked men‚Äôs player is a spearhead capable of doing his country proud. Masur also said he is hopeful Bernard Tomic will be able to patch up his rift with Tennis Australia and resume his Davis Cup career in the near future.

Kyrgios has become a human headline this year, with his brash on-court antics and demeanour off the court drawing plenty of criticism. The world No41 even weighed into Tomic‚Äôs rift with TA last week, accusing director of player performance Pat Rafter of being ‚Äúnegative‚Äù.

Tomic has been banned for the upcoming Davis Cup tie but Kyrgios will headline an Australian outfit also featuring Lleyton Hewitt, Thanasi Kokkinakis and Sam Groth.

During Tuesday‚Äôs media conference, Kyrgios was asked whether his recent controversies ‚Äì including a turbulent Wimbledon campaign where he was accused of tanking ‚Äì had made him a liability.

But Masur quickly jumped in to defend his star charge. ‚ÄúNick a liability for the Davis Cup? Absolutely not,‚Äù Masur said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs here, he‚Äôs got the green and gold on, he‚Äôs one hell of a tennis player. That doesn‚Äôt make him a liability, it actually makes him the spearhead.‚Äù

Tomic was axed from Davis Cup duties after accusing TA of abandoning him after he underwent double hip surgery last year. The world No25 also claimed that Rafter had no idea how to control the budget for player funding and was merely a ‚Äúmask‚Äù for chief executive Craig Tiley.

The rift took a comical twist on Monday when TA distributed an email listing Tomic as having an upcoming appearance at the ‚ÄúHall of Shame Tennis Championships‚Äù. TA insist the matter was no more than a typo, and that the email should have read: ‚ÄúHall of Fame Tennis Championships‚Äù.

Related: Bernard Tomic's family consider legal action over 'Hall of Shame' email

Tomic and his dad are exploring their legal options over the issue, with the matter an unwanted distraction as Australia attempt to power their way into the Davis Cup semi-finals.

‚ÄúI hope this [whole feud] can be resolved down the track, so Bernie can take his rightful place in the team,‚Äù Masur said.

Australia‚Äôs infighting hasn‚Äôt escaped the attention of Kazakhstan, who have reached the quarter-finals in four of the past five years but are yet to make the final four.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre reading the papers and at times it‚Äôs entertaining, but of course we understand Tennis Australia is experiencing maybe some current challenges before this important match,‚Äù Kazakhstan captain Dias Doskarayev said.

Masur said the Kazakhs‚Äô 3-2 dispatch of Italy in the first round ‚Äúcertainly sets off alarm bells‚Äù, and praised their positive attitude and respect for the competition.

World No63 Mikhail Kukushkin is Kazakhstan‚Äôs highest ranked player, while the visitors are expected to use world No115 Aleksandr Nedovyesov for the second singles rubber.

displayImages.altText: Nick Kyrgios, flanked by Thanasi Kokkinakis and Wally Masur, fields questions from the media on Tuesday, including one about whether he has become a liability for the team.

headerImage.caption: Nick Kyrgios, flanked by Thanasi Kokkinakis and Wally Masur, fields questions from the media on Tuesday, including one about whether he has become a liability for the team. Photograph: Neda Vanovac/AAP
headerImage.altText: Nick Kyrgios, flanked by Thanasi Kokkinakis and Wally Masur, fields questions from the media on Tuesday, including one about whether he has become a liability for the team.
headerImage.cleanCaption: Nick Kyrgios, flanked by Thanasi Kokkinakis and Wally Masur, fields questions from the media on Tuesday, including one about whether he has become a liability for the team.

snap.title: Australia's Nick Kyrgios fit to play Davis Cup quarter-final despite injury scare

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios, flanked by Thanasi Kokkinakis and Wally Masur, fields questions from the media on Tuesday, including one about whether he has become a liability for the team.

cards.title: Olympic Games 2016 / New Zealand Football launch appeal over Olympic qualifying expulsion
cards.rawTitle: New Zealand Football launch appeal over Olympic qualifying expulsion

item.title: New Zealand Football launch appeal over Olympic qualifying expulsion
item.trailText: New Zealand Football have launched an appeal over the decision to expel them from the Oceania Football Confederation‚Äôs Olympic qualifying final for fielding an ineligible player
item.standFirst:
• Kiwis thrown out of qualifying tournament final for fielding ineligible player
  • New Zealand claim they liaised with OFC and Pacific Games on eligibility
item.body:
New Zealand Football have launched an appeal over the decision to expel them from the Oceania Football Confederation‚Äôs Olympic qualifying final for fielding an ineligible player.

New Zealand‚Äôs Under-23 side were expelled just hours before Sunday‚Äôs final against Fiji, who went on to beat Vanuatu to advance as Oceania‚Äôs representative at next year‚Äôs Rio Games.

After losing 2-0 to New Zealand in the semi-finals, Vanuatu lodged a protest against the eligibility of South Africa-born defender Deklan Wynne with the OFC Disciplinary Committee. The committee deemed Wynne, who moved to New Zealand as a child with his family, was ineligible and awarded the game to Vanuatu 2-0 instead.

Related: New Zealand thrown out of Olympic qualifying after fielding ineligible player

NZF reacted angrily to the decision and were aghast the OFC had not told them of the outcome until just hours before the final. They also said they had been led to believe that Fifa would be making a determination on the outcome of Vanuatu‚Äôs appeal.

NZF chief executive Andy Martin said in a statement on Monday their lawyers were preparing an appeal to the OFC. The statement added that NZF had liaised with the OFC and the organisers of the Pacific Games, which was hosting the Olympic qualifying tournament, on the eligibility of all members of its squad.

‚ÄúNew Zealand Football has acted in good faith at all times and we would have expected any issues on player eligibility to have been raised in advance, through the process we were given, so that they could have been dealt with properly in a timely fashion,‚Äù Martin said.

Wynne was deemed ineligible under Article 7 of Fifa‚Äôs statutes which relate to a player acquiring a new nationality. Under the article, the player, a parent or grandparent must have been born in the country they wish to represent.

If they are ineligible under the first three criteria, they can qualify if they have lived in the country for five years continuously since the age of 18, making the 20-year-old Wynne too young to qualify under that clause.

displayImages.altText: Defender Deklan Wynne is at the centre of the controversy that could see New Zealand miss out on a third straight appearance at the Olympic Games.

headerImage.caption: Defender Deklan Wynne is at the centre of the controversy that could see New Zealand miss out on a third straight appearance at the Olympic Games. Photograph: Michael Bradley/AFP/Getty Images
headerImage.altText: Defender Deklan Wynne is at the centre of the controversy that could see New Zealand miss out on a third straight appearance at the Olympic Games.
headerImage.cleanCaption: Defender Deklan Wynne is at the centre of the controversy that could see New Zealand miss out on a third straight appearance at the Olympic Games.

snap.title: New Zealand Football launch appeal over Olympic qualifying expulsion

image.altText: Defender Deklan Wynne is at the centre of the controversy that could see New Zealand miss out on a third straight appearance at the Olympic Games.

cards.title: Sailing / Coast Guard suspends search for missing Olympic sailor Trevor Moore
cards.rawTitle: Coast Guard suspends search for missing Olympic sailor Trevor Moore

item.title: Coast Guard suspends search for missing Olympic sailor Trevor Moore
item.trailText: On Thursday an unmanned inflatable dinghy was reported adrift with items belonging to Trevor Moore
item.standFirst: On Thursday an unmanned inflatable dinghy was reported adrift with items belonging to Trevor Moore
item.body:
The Coast Guard suspended its search Saturday in Biscayne Bay outside Miami for a missing sailor who was a member of the 2012 US Olympic sailing team.

Coast Guard officials in Miami say they received a report Thursday evening about an unmanned inflatable dinghy adrift in Dinner Key. Items belonging to 30-year-old Trevor Moore were onboard.

Moore is from Naples and was last seen wearing a dark shirt and swim shorts.

Capt Michael Long of the Coast Guard said in a news release: ‚ÄúOur thoughts and prayers go out to the loved ones affected. Despite the tireless search efforts by multiple agencies and good Samaritans, we were unable to find Mr Moore.‚Äù

The Coast Guard and partner agencies covered more than 510 square nautical miles before suspending the three-day search.

displayImages.altText: Trevor Moore is shown in January 2011

headerImage.caption: The 30-year-old Moore is from Naples, Florida, and was last seen wearing a dark shirt and swim shorts. Photograph: Reuters
headerImage.altText: Trevor Moore is shown in January 2011
headerImage.cleanCaption: The 30-year-old Moore is from Naples, Florida, and was last seen wearing a dark shirt and swim shorts.

snap.title: Coast Guard suspends search for missing Olympic sailor Trevor Moore

image.altText: Trevor Moore is shown in January 2011
